edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.util
Class TCPMessageHandler

java.lang.Object
  edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.util.TCPMessageHandler

public class TCPMessageHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Sends/recieves a message over an established TCP connection. To be a message means the unit of write/read is demarcated in some way. In this implementation, that's done by prefixing the data with a 4-byte length field.

Note used in Project 1.

Author:
zahorjan

Method Detail

intToByte

protected static byte[] intToByte(int i)
We need an "on the wire" format for a binary integer. This method encodes into that format, which is little endian (low order bits of int are in element [0] of byte array, etc.).

Parameters:
i -
Returns:
A byte[4] encoding the integer argument.

byteToInt

protected static int byteToInt(byte[] buf)
We need an "on the wire" format for a binary integer. This method decodes from that format, which is little endian (low order bits of int are in element [0] of byte array, etc.).

Parameters:
buf -
Returns:

discard

public void discard()
Closes the underlying socket and associated streams. The TCPMessageHandler object is unusable after execution of this method.

readFromStream

protected byte[] readFromStream(int nBytes)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Helper routine that reads a particular number of bytes from connection.

Parameters:
nBytes - Number of bytes to read. Must be greater than zero.
Returns:
Throws EOFException if EOF reached; throws an IOException if less than nBytes read or nBytes is zero. Otherwise returns a byte[nBytes] array of received data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
